## Checklist

From [course website](https://microbiome.github.io/course_2023_oulu/start.html)

-   Test login to CSC cloud (optionally, set up your own R)

-   Watch [short online videos](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjiXAZO27elAJEptP59BN3whVJ61XIkST) on microbiome data science

-   Try out reproducible reporting with [Quarto](https://microbiome.github.io/OMA/resources.html#quarto)

-   Read about the selected demo data: [HintikkaXOData](https://microbiome.github.io/OMA/containers.html#hintikka-desc). You can also try to load it in R and explore the data structure.

-   Optionally: Read through reading tips ([OMA](https://microbiome.github.io/OMA) & [manuscripts](https://microbiome.github.io/course_2023_oulu/start.html#reading))

-   Online support: for installation and other issues, join us at [Gitter](https://microbiome.github.io/OMA/training.html#support-and-resources).

## Software & learning environment

-   **Pre-installed system** Temporary access to the notebook cloud environment provided by CSC with preinstalled software.

-   **Your own system** encouraged to test the installation on your own system; limited support for this will be available.

## CSC Notebook

-   Offers web applications for self-learning, hosting courses and collaboration provided by CSC.

-   [CSC -- IT Center for Science](https://www.csc.fi/) is a Finnish center of expertise in information technology.

-   CSC is owned by the Finnish state and higher education institutions.

-   Services: High-performance computing, data management, cloud, software.

## CSC cloud notebook

-   Login with CSC/Haka or Guest account

-   Preinstalled R packages

-   8 Gb memory

-   8 hour uptime at one go

-   Shared data workspace

## Instructions to login

-   Instructions to access the environment will be sent to the registered participants.

1.  Read the [General instructions](https://docs.csc.fi/cloud/csc_notebooks/guide_for_students/)

2.  Go to the [CSC notebook front page](https://notebooks.rahtiapp.fi/welcome).

3.  Login

    a\. Haka login

    b\. CSC login

    c\. Special login

## Haka login

-   If you have a Finnish university account, you should be able to login with Haka

    1.  Press **Login** button from the frontpage
    2.  Press **Haka** button
    3.  Select right organization
    4.  Enter login information

## CSC login

-   You can create a CSC account by following the instructions

    1.  Press **Login** button from the frontpage
    2.  Press **CSC** button
    3.  Enter login information

## Special login

-   For those who cannot login with Haka or CSC account

    1.  Contact Jeba on [gitter](https://app.gitter.im/#/room/#microbiome_miaverse:gitter.im) if you are not able to login

    2.  We will give you guest account

    3.  Press **Special login** button from the front page (below the **Login** button)

    4.  Enter login information

## Joining workspace

1.  Join workspace

    a\. Press **Join workspace** button (Top right corner)

    b\. Enter the **Join Code** (Check your email)

2.  Start session

    -   Press **ON** button

3.  Save files to **my-work**

## Teaching environment {.smaller}

1.  Open the course website
2.  Show instructions
3.  Show the front page
4.  Explain login options (personal or guest account)
5.  Join workspace with the join code (Workspace means this course)
6.  Open new session
7.  Session lifetime: need to open new session every day (to save computer resources)
8.  Rstudio intro (if necessary)
9.  Using folders
10. my-work will be there as long as workspace is there (half year)
11. You can download those by e.g. copy-pasting, or exportin the file
12. Saving workspace to your directory (optional)
